title: 63 Best Gift Ideas for Men 2025: Presents That Won’t Disappoint
description: Stumped for Valentine's Day ideas? We’re on the case
author: Audrey Lee, Erika Owen
excerpt: Impress him with one of the best gift ideas for men (according to us) like a new pizza oven, some elevated basics, or some thoughful decor to spruce up his home
text: All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.Guys can be disastrously tough to shop for, but the best gift ideas for men don’t have to involve a brainteaser. What do you buy for the dad with a fondness for practical things? Some elevated basics or tech essentials, not just another six-pack of tube socks, should do the trick. For the brother with a taste for the finer things? We’ve got some ideas of the luxury persuasion that don’t involve placing bids on Grailed or eBay. For the husband who claims to be OK with no gift at all (he’s lying), please resist the impulse to hit him with a gift card. There are several handsome layering options to get him through the last of this cold spell, along with some cooking upgrades that will please even the man who struggles with paint-by-numbers meal kit recipes (ahem, a pizza oven might change his life).We’ve got a lot of ideas for covetable presents at every price point where that came from, which we’ve dutifully compiled for you (ahead of Valentine’s Day, birthdays, Father’s Day, and all the other holidays to come). We think these will please the pickiest men in your life who are, honestly, terrible at dropping hints. So, without further ado, read on for the AD edit of our favorite gift ideas for men.The Best Gift Ideas for Men, According to UsBest Jewelry Gift: Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet, $98Best Subscription Gift: Atlas Coffee Subscription, $60 $50Best Travel Gift: Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack, $198Best Decor Gift: Braun Analogue Wall Clock, $47Best Self-Care Gift: Theragun Prime Plus, $399Best Gift for Aspiring Chefs: Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven, $399 $319Browse According to Category:Accessories and Apparel Gifts | Home and Kitchen Gifts | Self-Care and Tech GiftsAccessories & ApparelLululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle BackpackNever underestimate the power of a nice duffel bag. This one seamlessly converts into a backpack—a massive perk if the guy in your life is often on the go. It’s made with water-repellant fabric, and features tons of exterior and interior pocket space, a handy water bottle pouch, adjustable straps, and a sleek look that won’t clash with the rest of his travel fits.Bottega Veneta Intrecciato Leather Card CaseA black leather wallet might seem like a boring gift, but Bottega Veneta would say otherwise. This slim card holder with the brand’s signature leather weave is just the right kind of luxe surprise.Mejuri Square Box Chain BraceletWhen in doubt, keep it simple. With a classic bracelet in his arsenal (in either sterling silver or 14k gold), he’ll have the perfect accessory to fix up any outfit.Barbour Ashby Waxed Cotton JacketThis classic wax jacket can easily be dressed up or down, whether he’s headed to the office or checking out Glastonbury this year. Barbour is a classic for a reason—the English brand has nailed the balance between “lightweight and breathable” and “durable enough to qualify as a family heirloom.”Patagonia Synchilla Fleece GlovesIf his favorite T-shirts and pullovers come from Patagonia, these gloves in the brand’s warm Synchilla recycled fleece material will likely be a winner.Quince Onyx Rectangular RingSome of the best men’s gifts come in small packages—like this 18k gold vermeil ring. It’s subtle enough to pair well with a T-shirt but can pull its own weight with a suit as well.The North Face Thermoball Traction Mule V Mens SlippersHe’ll think of you every time he slides into these rubber-sole slippers (which will be often).A.P.C. Treck BackpackLevel up his college-era backpack with this sleek A.P.C. number. It’s designed with adjustable padded shoulder straps for maximum comfort and has a branded carabiner clip that’ll be a subtle nod to his climbing hobby.J.Crew Sterling Silver Cuff LinksYou don’t have to be into jewelry to appreciate some handsome cuff links peeking out of a crisp, French cuff shirt. This heirloom-worthy sterling silver pair is simple, understated, and elegant for dressing up a suit or doing the most at the office.Lululemon Down for It All 700-Down-Fill VestThis transitional period between winter and spring can be confusing. We like to think of it as ‘vest weather,’ AKA temperatures that call for something with a bit of warmth but nothing overly restricting. This Lululemon vest definitely fits the bill: It’s down-filled and designed to regulate his body temperature, plus stylish enough to sport in public.Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed BeanieCrafted with Mongolian cashmere, this super soft ribbed beanie is a wintertime staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie).Buck Mason Vintage Thermal HenleyWhile sweats will always have their place in a loungewear collection, we’re all about the henleys for cooler temps. Made of woven cotton and available in five handsome colors, this tee plays well on its own or paired with his favorite jeans. He’ll love the versatility, which is a gift in itself.Parachute Cloud Cotton RobeThis lightweight Turkish cotton bath robe is exactly what he’ll want to live in on lazy mornings or weekends spent rotting in bed.Our Legacy Cotton Coach JacketCater to your favorite menswearhead’s love of Scandi design with this timeless work jacket from Swedish–based Our Legacy. A staple that can be dressed up or down, the sturdy cotton material is cut with a slightly dropped shoulder silhouette that’ll give your guy the boxier fit he prefers.Prada America's Cup Low Top SneakerHe might not speak Italian but he definitely speaks Prada, and a classic America’s Cup trainer will get him far. It’ll look great with more casual suits as well as his weekend uniform of jeans and a T-shirt he’s had in his closet for 10 years.Nike Dri-FIT Club Unstructured Metal Swoosh CapPerfect for tee time or a morning run, this lightweight cap can weather whatever his sport is. It’s made of Nike’s Dri-FIT tech, designed to wick sweat away quicker, and will help him stay dry and comfortable during rigorous training days.The Elder Statesman Bolt Checkerboard Knit BeanieWhile you might not be able to buy your best guy better game on the basketball court, you will be able to cop him the Elder Statesman beanie Jimmy Butler wore in his Open Door tour.MOFT Flash Wallet and StandSome people don’t love bulky phone cases with PopSockets and other gadgets…. But they still want a better grip and a spot to store often-used cards. This wallet doubles as a magnetic stand, meaning they can flip their phone into viewing mode in an instant.On Cloud 5 SneakersThe lightest-weight sneaker imaginable, On Cloud 5s are engineered for an active lifestyle. Your sporty dude can wear them all day long, from the gym to the streets.Omega SpeedMaster Professional MoonwatchAn exceptional guy calls for an exceptional timepiece. For marking especially important milestones, this Omega watch is a gift that will be hard to topMark & Graham Monogrammed Travel Watch RollIf they can’t be seen without their favorite watch (or second-favorite, or third-favorite) fastened around their wrist, upgrade their travel accessory situation with this personalized gift. Made of durable polyurethane exterior and a soft microsuede interior (no scratches here!), there’s enough room for three watches inside.Bombas Sunday SlipperIt’s more than likely the old slippers he’s using are hanging on by a thread. These elevated designs from Bombas are ultra cozy and won’t be an eyesore.Polo Ralph Lauren Plaid Fringe Wool ScarfA luxe scarf is one of those things we’ll always want but won’t necessarily buy for ourselves. But unwrapping a present and seeing the peek of plaid and fringe? You won’t find many people who wouldn’t be delighted to open up a stylish scarf. This design from Polo is the perfect pop of color for any look.Home & KitchenOoni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza OvenIt’s not a car, but your brother will feel like he’s on Top Chef with this gas-powered pizza oven that reaches an impressive 950 degrees in 15 minutes and cooks a 12-inch pie in just 60 seconds.Atlas Coffee Club Gift SubscriptionThis gift subscription from Atlas Coffee Company will supply him with three-to-twelve months of the best beans around. You'll be able to select when shipments start and each delivery postcards and tasting notes.Make Your Own Hot Sauce KitIt seems like there are only two sides to the hot sauce spectrum: You either love it—like “can’t get enough heat” kind of obsession—or you avoid it at all costs. For the former, this set will let them tweak that liquid gold within an inch of the preference.Braun Classic Analogue Wall ClockWe all have that friend who is constantly late. This wall clock probably won’t help that cause, but its slight utilitarian vibe makes it a designer-level addition to any room.Technivorm Moccamaster 53942 KBGVThe sunny Moccamaster coffee maker from Technivorm is one of the most stylish machines out there. Thanks to its simplicity and dialed-in design, it’s super easy to use—you just fill the brew basket, add water, and flip the on/off switch. It brews in just 5-6 minutes and can handle up to 10 cups of coffee at one time. Plus, the pop of yellow would look great on any countertop.Craighill Cal Bookend (Pair)Bibliophiles and paperback aficionados can rest assured that these sleek-looking bookends from Craighill will support their reads.Weber Small Stainless Steel Vegetable BasketFor the BBQ grill master who has everything, this small vegetable basket is up there on the Mount Rushmore of thoughtful gifts. It helps keep veggies in one place and not completely charred while delivering all the flavor a grill has to offer.Corkcicle Chillsner (Two-Pack)Beer bottles, on the other hand, are best kept chilled with Corkcicle’s Chillsner, an icy stick that you pop in the freezer (and a best seller from our Father’s Day gift guide). Paired with a few nice beer glasses, this two-pack is a unique gift that ensures your beer lover will never sip warm brew again.Ember Temperature Control Smart MugNo one likes lukewarm coffee. In lieu of a boring water bottle, keep your man’s java piping hot with this temperature control smart mug that you can operate with a smartphone. And thanks to Amazon’s speedy shipping, we think it would make an especially nice last-minute gift.Shinola Runwell Desk ClockEven better than wrist candy, this chrome-and-black Shinola desk clock is the perfect home decor gift for your watch collector brother. Plus, the handsome timepiece is accompanied by a convenient wooden stand.Snow Peak Takibi Fire & GrillA top-rated Japanese grill will dazzle the stylish camper (glamper?) in your life—the one who hits the campsite with a full Arc’teryx kit outside their tech job and actually lets his Salomons touch grass. Plus, it’ll complete his set-up, which already includes a matching Snowpeak tent, Helinox chair, and Patagonia sleeping bag.Birdfy Smart Bird Feeder with CameraTake his amateur bird-watching hobby to the next level with this chic-looking bird feeder that uses AI to identify what kinds of winged friends are visiting the smart hangout.Butcher's Choice BoxThis gift box from Porter Road is a griller’s delight. The handpicked curation includes a selection of dry aged steaks, sirloin filets, pork chops, dry aged ground beef, a pound of pork bacon, plus a seasonal item that changes each month.Houseplant Green Ridge AshtraySmoking accessories don’t get more luxe than the designs coming from Houseplant. This particular ashtray’s shape is inspired by a salty snack—who knew ridges could provide such a picturesque holding spot for a cigarette or joint?Brightland Mini EssentialsWith high-quality olive oils and vinegars, a little bit goes a long way. That’s why this sampler set of Brightland’s four essential bottles is the ideal gift for any aspiring cook or foodie dude.Breville Barista Express Espresso MachineMake your coffee lover into a barista with this user-friendly Breville espresso machine. Thanks to the integrated grinder, it’s a one-stop-shop for cappuccinos, macchiatos, and all the other delicious third-wave coffee drinks out there.Aarke Copper Carbonator 3If he's a big seltzer guy this Aarke is pretty much the Rolls-Royce of carbonator. It'll look extra-sleek sitting on his countertop next to his collection of matching copper pots and pans.New York Times Custom Football BookWhether you’re shopping for a Christmas present or birthday gift, your favorite football fan will love an anthology on their go-to team. These books gather printed coverage from The New York Times to create a history of some of the most popular football teams in the country.Mercado Famous Holy JamonMercado Famous’s Jamón sampler is a thoughtful gift idea for your fave foodie. Each set comes with all three of the brand’s tasty packs sourced from Spain and ready to eat.Do Your Whiskey Make Your Own Whiskey KitThis creative DIY whiskey kit includes three types of oak and six herbs and spices so your dude can blend his own whiskey mix. Though if you’re looking to go above and beyond, we recommend also checking out this personalized barrel from Uncommon Goods.YETI Colster Can InsulatorNever let your man’s beer (or seltzer!) get warm with Yeti’s sleek can insulator that maintains the liquid’s straight-out-of-the-cooler temperature even on the hottest of summer days. A matching keychain and a pack of his favorite brew should elevate the surprise.Material Trio of KnivesAnother kitchen must-have, this trio of knives is made of cryogenically-tempered Japanese stainless steel and high carbon, with stain-resistant composite handles. With these three in his arsenal, your dude can whip up anything.Bellhop Table Lamp by Edward Barber, Jay Osgerby for FLOSIf they’re the light of your life, light up theirs with one of our favorite portable lamps. The Mug by East ForkWhether it’s coffee or tea that starts their mornings, this new mug from East Fork will easily become the new favorite.Great Jones x Fellow KettlePerfect for hot beverages, or for when he’s craving instant ramen on the spot, Fellow’s colorful collaboration with Great Jones is an elevated kitchen staple that gets our seal of approval.Self-care & tech giftsLe Labo Hinoki Hand PomadeChapped hands don’t stand a chance against Le Labo’s moisturizer, which features a nourishing blend of shea butter, coconut oil, and almond oil.Brooklinen Weighted Throw BlanketSometimes the cure for a bad day is diving right under a weighted blanket and staying put for an hour or three. Clocking in at 12 pounds, this breathable throw is light enough to nap under without having claustrophobic nightmares.Aesop Murasaki Aromatique IncenseIf candles aren’t his vibe, he might enjoy space-cleansing with some Japanese-inspired incense from Aesop, the same brand that makes his favorite hand soap and lotion duo.Hotdot Rechargeable Hand WarmersThese electric hand warmers are an especially great gift idea that’ll keep his hands toasty on the trek from the slopes to apres ski happy hour. They have four temperature settings from 104°F to 131°F, can run for up to 20 hours with each charge, and are lightweight enough to take on the go.Apple AirTag (4-Pack)We all lose things; there’s no getting around that. But have them slap an AirTag on that thing they keep misplacing—keys, phone, headphones, shame (just kidding on that last one, we can’t help there)—and it’ll instantly lower their stress levels.Tsu Lange Yor Aromatic Candle Art (Set of 3)Get his space one step closer to Troye Sivan's Australian hideaway with this scent set from the It-Boy's brand. It includes all three sultry scents—TLY 5755, Pool, and Sassafras—that are housed in candles he can proudly display in his own bachelor pad.Pioneer DJ DDJ-REV7 2-Channel Motorized DJ ControllerFor the guy who loves to control the aux—this professional DJ deck is bound to delight. Don't be surprised if he spends the next few months on set lists to be performed at the next house party or rooftop gathering.Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth HeadphonesAudiophiles will never refuse an upgrade to their headphones. When it comes to tech gifts, there are lots of audio options out there, but these over-ear ones from Bose offer world-class noise cancellation, Bluetooth pairing they won’t have to fight to actually use, and a noise-rejecting microphone system. It’s a whole lot of power in a beautiful package. Go forth and skip the Apple Watch in favor of something a bit different.Hatch Restore 2 Bedside Light, Sound Machine & Sunrise Alarm ClockGetting up is hard and anyone who says otherwise is (probably) lying a little bit. The Hatch lamp helps make it a little easier, probably because it’s a full-fledged wake-up machine in one tiny package. Not only can the user set the traditional alarm, but there’s a time-activated light “alarm” that makes it feel like a little sliver of the sun has slipped right into the room. To round things out, the sound machine is great for lulling people to sleep.Cozy Earth Serenity Silk Sleep MaskIt’s likely he wouldn’t think of all the benefits a silk sleep mask might have on his nighttime routine—but you will.Loftie Alarm ClockWaking up is slightly easier when you have an alarm clock that houses meditations, breath work circuits, Bluetooth speaker capabilities, and a gentle two-step system for jostling someone out of sleep. This is that alarm clock.Postcard Cabins StayIf he’s a nature buff, a weekend trip courtesy of Postcard Cabins is a gift the both of you can enjoy. With cabins located nationwide and stays starting at $109 per night (pending location, seasonality, and availability), a picturesque vacation is just a few clicks away.Sonos RoamMinimalist, compact, and rechargeable, this portable waterproof smart bluetooth speaker is chic enough to display at home, yet also small enough to bring along just about anywhere.Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation)If your dad is still listening to podcasts with wired headphones, Apple AirPods are a sure-fire gift choice that he can pair perfectly with his iPhone via Bluetooth. Not only are these earbuds wireless, but they also boast noise-cancellation technology for an immersive music experience.Theragun Prime PlusIf he works out and travels a lot, this tiny muscle massager is one of the best gift ideas out there. The upgraded Theragun Prime Plus packs a ton of power into its three foam attachments. Plus its Bluetooth capability means you can connect it to the Theragun app for personalized use recommendations.Bang & Olufsen Beolit 20 SpeakerIf you'd rather take your audio cues from Alicia Keys and Swizz Beatz, gift him this portable speaker that's got Up to 37 hours of playtime, charges in 3 hours, and has a convenient handle for carrying to the BBQ or park hang.
html:
All products featured on Architectural Digest are independently selected by our editors. However, when you buy something through our retail links, we may earn an affiliate commission.

Guys can be disastrously tough to shop for, but the best gift ideas for men don’t have to involve a brainteaser. What do you buy for the dad with a fondness for practical things? Some elevated basics or tech essentials, not just another six-pack of tube socks, should do the trick. For the brother with a taste for the finer things? We’ve got some ideas of the luxury persuasion that don’t involve placing bids on Grailed or eBay. For the husband who claims to be OK with no gift at all (he’s lying), please resist the impulse to hit him with a gift card. There are several handsome layering options to get him through the last of this cold spell, along with some cooking upgrades that will please even the man who struggles with paint-by-numbers meal kit recipes (ahem, a pizza oven might change his life).

We’ve got a lot of ideas for covetable presents at every price point where that came from, which we’ve dutifully compiled for you (ahead of Valentine’s Day, birthdays, Father’s Day, and all the other holidays to come). We think these will please the pickiest men in your life who are, honestly, terrible at dropping hints. So, without further ado, read on for the AD edit of our favorite gift ideas for men.

The Best Gift Ideas for Men, According to Us

  • Best Jewelry Gift: Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet, $98
  • Best Subscription Gift: Atlas Coffee Subscription, $60 $50
  • Best Travel Gift: Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack, $198
  • Best Decor Gift: Braun Analogue Wall Clock, $47
  • Best Self-Care Gift: Theragun Prime Plus, $399
  • Best Gift for Aspiring Chefs: Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven, $399 $319

Browse According to Category:

Accessories and Apparel Gifts | Home and Kitchen Gifts | Self-Care and Tech Gifts

Accessories & Apparel

Lululemon 2-in-1 Travel Duffle Backpack

Never underestimate the power of a nice duffel bag. This one seamlessly converts into a backpack—a massive perk if the guy in your life is often on the go. It’s made with water-repellant fabric, and features tons of exterior and interior pocket space, a handy water bottle pouch, adjustable straps, and a sleek look that won’t clash with the rest of his travel fits.

Bottega Veneta Intrecciato Leather Card Case

A black leather wallet might seem like a boring gift, but Bottega Veneta would say otherwise. This slim card holder with the brand’s signature leather weave is just the right kind of luxe surprise.

Mejuri Square Box Chain Bracelet

When in doubt, keep it simple. With a classic bracelet in his arsenal (in either sterling silver or 14k gold), he’ll have the perfect accessory to fix up any outfit.

Barbour Ashby Waxed Cotton Jacket

This classic wax jacket can easily be dressed up or down, whether he’s headed to the office or checking out Glastonbury this year. Barbour is a classic for a reason—the English brand has nailed the balance between “lightweight and breathable” and “durable enough to qualify as a family heirloom.”

Patagonia Synchilla Fleece Gloves

If his favorite T-shirts and pullovers come from Patagonia, these gloves in the brand’s warm Synchilla recycled fleece material will likely be a winner.

Quince Onyx Rectangular Ring

Some of the best men’s gifts come in small packages—like this 18k gold vermeil ring. It’s subtle enough to pair well with a T-shirt but can pull its own weight with a suit as well.

The North Face Thermoball Traction Mule V Mens Slippers

He’ll think of you every time he slides into these rubber-sole slippers (which will be often).

A.P.C. Treck Backpack

Level up his college-era backpack with this sleek A.P.C. number. It’s designed with adjustable padded shoulder straps for maximum comfort and has a branded carabiner clip that’ll be a subtle nod to his climbing hobby.

J.Crew Sterling Silver Cuff Links

You don’t have to be into jewelry to appreciate some handsome cuff links peeking out of a crisp, French cuff shirt. This heirloom-worthy sterling silver pair is simple, understated, and elegant for dressing up a suit or doing the most at the office.

Lululemon Down for It All 700-Down-Fill Vest

This transitional period between winter and spring can be confusing. We like to think of it as ‘vest weather,’ AKA temperatures that call for something with a bit of warmth but nothing overly restricting. This Lululemon vest definitely fits the bill: It’s down-filled and designed to regulate his body temperature, plus stylish enough to sport in public.

Quince Mongolian Cashmere Ribbed Beanie

Crafted with Mongolian cashmere, this super soft ribbed beanie is a wintertime staple (we think it would pair perfectly with the brand’s cashmere hoodie).

Buck Mason Vintage Thermal Henley

While sweats will always have their place in a loungewear collection, we’re all about the henleys for cooler temps. Made of woven cotton and available in five handsome colors, this tee plays well on its own or paired with his favorite jeans. He’ll love the versatility, which is a gift in itself.

Parachute Cloud Cotton Robe

This lightweight Turkish cotton bath robe is exactly what he’ll want to live in on lazy mornings or weekends spent rotting in bed.

Our Legacy Cotton Coach Jacket

Cater to your favorite menswearhead’s love of Scandi design with this timeless work jacket from Swedish–based Our Legacy. A staple that can be dressed up or down, the sturdy cotton material is cut with a slightly dropped shoulder silhouette that’ll give your guy the boxier fit he prefers.

Prada America's Cup Low Top Sneaker

He might not speak Italian but he definitely speaks Prada, and a classic America’s Cup trainer will get him far. It’ll look great with more casual suits as well as his weekend uniform of jeans and a T-shirt he’s had in his closet for 10 years.

Nike Dri-FIT Club Unstructured Metal Swoosh Cap

Perfect for tee time or a morning run, this lightweight cap can weather whatever his sport is. It’s made of Nike’s Dri-FIT tech, designed to wick sweat away quicker, and will help him stay dry and comfortable during rigorous training days.

The Elder Statesman Bolt Checkerboard Knit Beanie

While you might not be able to buy your best guy better game on the basketball court, you will be able to cop him the Elder Statesman beanie Jimmy Butler wore in his Open Door tour.

MOFT Flash Wallet and Stand

Some people don’t love bulky phone cases with PopSockets and other gadgets…. But they still want a better grip and a spot to store often-used cards. This wallet doubles as a magnetic stand, meaning they can flip their phone into viewing mode in an instant.

On Cloud 5 Sneakers

The lightest-weight sneaker imaginable, On Cloud 5s are engineered for an active lifestyle. Your sporty dude can wear them all day long, from the gym to the streets.

Omega SpeedMaster Professional Moonwatch

An exceptional guy calls for an exceptional timepiece. For marking especially important milestones, this Omega watch is a gift that will be hard to top

Mark & Graham Monogrammed Travel Watch Roll

If they can’t be seen without their favorite watch (or second-favorite, or third-favorite) fastened around their wrist, upgrade their travel accessory situation with this personalized gift. Made of durable polyurethane exterior and a soft microsuede interior (no scratches here!), there’s enough room for three watches inside.

Bombas Sunday Slipper

It’s more than likely the old slippers he’s using are hanging on by a thread. These elevated designs from Bombas are ultra cozy and won’t be an eyesore.

Polo Ralph Lauren Plaid Fringe Wool Scarf

A luxe scarf is one of those things we’ll always want but won’t necessarily buy for ourselves. But unwrapping a present and seeing the peek of plaid and fringe? You won’t find many people who wouldn’t be delighted to open up a stylish scarf. This design from Polo is the perfect pop of color for any look.

Home & Kitchen

Ooni Koda 12 Gas Powered Pizza Oven

It’s not a car, but your brother will feel like he’s on Top Chef with this gas-powered pizza oven that reaches an impressive 950 degrees in 15 minutes and cooks a 12-inch pie in just 60 seconds.

Atlas Coffee Club Gift Subscription

This gift subscription from Atlas Coffee Company will supply him with three-to-twelve months of the best beans around. You'll be able to select when shipments start and each delivery postcards and tasting notes.

Make Your Own Hot Sauce Kit

It seems like there are only two sides to the hot sauce spectrum: You either love it—like “can’t get enough heat” kind of obsession—or you avoid it at all costs. For the former, this set will let them tweak that liquid gold within an inch of the preference.

Braun Classic Analogue Wall Clock

We all have that friend who is constantly late. This wall clock probably won’t help that cause, but its slight utilitarian vibe makes it a designer-level addition to any room.

Technivorm Moccamaster 53942 KBGV

The sunny Moccamaster coffee maker from Technivorm is one of the most stylish machines out there. Thanks to its simplicity and dialed-in design, it’s super easy to use—you just fill the brew basket, add water, and flip the on/off switch. It brews in just 5-6 minutes and can handle up to 10 cups of coffee at one time. Plus, the pop of yellow would look great on any countertop.

Craighill Cal Bookend (Pair)

Bibliophiles and paperback aficionados can rest assured that these sleek-looking bookends from Craighill will support their reads.

Weber Small Stainless Steel Vegetable Basket

For the BBQ grill master who has everything, this small vegetable basket is up there on the Mount Rushmore of thoughtful gifts. It helps keep veggies in one place and not completely charred while delivering all the flavor a grill has to offer.

Corkcicle Chillsner (Two-Pack)

Beer bottles, on the other hand, are best kept chilled with Corkcicle’s Chillsner, an icy stick that you pop in the freezer (and a best seller from our Father’s Day gift guide). Paired with a few nice beer glasses, this two-pack is a unique gift that ensures your beer lover will never sip warm brew again.

Ember Temperature Control Smart Mug

No one likes lukewarm coffee. In lieu of a boring water bottle, keep your man’s java piping hot with this temperature control smart mug that you can operate with a smartphone. And thanks to Amazon’s speedy shipping, we think it would make an especially nice last-minute gift.

Shinola Runwell Desk Clock

Even better than wrist candy, this chrome-and-black Shinola desk clock is the perfect home decor gift for your watch collector brother. Plus, the handsome timepiece is accompanied by a convenient wooden stand.

Snow Peak Takibi Fire & Grill

A top-rated Japanese grill will dazzle the stylish camper (glamper?) in your life—the one who hits the campsite with a full Arc’teryx kit outside their tech job and actually lets his Salomons touch grass. Plus, it’ll complete his set-up, which already includes a matching Snowpeak tent, Helinox chair, and Patagonia sleeping bag.

Birdfy Smart Bird Feeder with Camera

Take his amateur bird-watching hobby to the next level with this chic-looking bird feeder that uses AI to identify what kinds of winged friends are visiting the smart hangout.

Butcher's Choice Box

This gift box from Porter Road is a griller’s delight. The handpicked curation includes a selection of dry aged steaks, sirloin filets, pork chops, dry aged ground beef, a pound of pork bacon, plus a seasonal item that changes each month.

Houseplant Green Ridge Ashtray

Smoking accessories don’t get more luxe than the designs coming from Houseplant. This particular ashtray’s shape is inspired by a salty snack—who knew ridges could provide such a picturesque holding spot for a cigarette or joint?

Brightland Mini Essentials

With high-quality olive oils and vinegars, a little bit goes a long way. That’s why this sampler set of Brightland’s four essential bottles is the ideal gift for any aspiring cook or foodie dude.

Breville Barista Express Espresso Machine

Make your coffee lover into a barista with this user-friendly Breville espresso machine. Thanks to the integrated grinder, it’s a one-stop-shop for cappuccinos, macchiatos, and all the other delicious third-wave coffee drinks out there.

Aarke Copper Carbonator 3

If he's a big seltzer guy this Aarke is pretty much the Rolls-Royce of carbonator. It'll look extra-sleek sitting on his countertop next to his collection of matching copper pots and pans.

New York Times Custom Football Book

Whether you’re shopping for a Christmas present or birthday gift, your favorite football fan will love an anthology on their go-to team. These books gather printed coverage from The New York Times to create a history of some of the most popular football teams in the country.

Mercado Famous Holy Jamon

Mercado Famous’s Jamón sampler is a thoughtful gift idea for your fave foodie. Each set comes with all three of the brand’s tasty packs sourced from Spain and ready to eat.

Do Your Whiskey Make Your Own Whiskey Kit

This creative DIY whiskey kit includes three types of oak and six herbs and spices so your dude can blend his own whiskey mix. Though if you’re looking to go above and beyond, we recommend also checking out this personalized barrel from Uncommon Goods.

YETI Colster Can Insulator

Never let your man’s beer (or seltzer!) get warm with Yeti’s sleek can insulator that maintains the liquid’s straight-out-of-the-cooler temperature even on the hottest of summer days. A matching keychain and a pack of his favorite brew should elevate the surprise.

Material Trio of Knives

Another kitchen must-have, this trio of knives is made of cryogenically-tempered Japanese stainless steel and high carbon, with stain-resistant composite handles. With these three in his arsenal, your dude can whip up anything.

Bellhop Table Lamp by Edward Barber, Jay Osgerby for FLOS

If they’re the light of your life, light up theirs with one of our favorite portable lamps.

The Mug by East Fork

Whether it’s coffee or tea that starts their mornings, this new mug from East Fork will easily become the new favorite.

Great Jones x Fellow Kettle

Perfect for hot beverages, or for when he’s craving instant ramen on the spot, Fellow’s colorful collaboration with Great Jones is an elevated kitchen staple that gets our seal of approval.

Self-care & tech gifts

Le Labo Hinoki Hand Pomade

Chapped hands don’t stand a chance against Le Labo’s moisturizer, which features a nourishing blend of shea butter, coconut oil, and almond oil.

Brooklinen Weighted Throw Blanket

Sometimes the cure for a bad day is diving right under a weighted blanket and staying put for an hour or three. Clocking in at 12 pounds, this breathable throw is light enough to nap under without having claustrophobic nightmares.

Aesop Murasaki Aromatique Incense

If candles aren’t his vibe, he might enjoy space-cleansing with some Japanese-inspired incense from Aesop, the same brand that makes his favorite hand soap and lotion duo.

Hotdot Rechargeable Hand Warmers

These electric hand warmers are an especially great gift idea that’ll keep his hands toasty on the trek from the slopes to apres ski happy hour. They have four temperature settings from 104°F to 131°F, can run for up to 20 hours with each charge, and are lightweight enough to take on the go.

Apple AirTag (4-Pack)

We all lose things; there’s no getting around that. But have them slap an AirTag on that thing they keep misplacing—keys, phone, headphones, shame (just kidding on that last one, we can’t help there)—and it’ll instantly lower their stress levels.

Tsu Lange Yor Aromatic Candle Art (Set of 3)

Get his space one step closer to Troye Sivan's Australian hideaway with this scent set from the It-Boy's brand. It includes all three sultry scents—TLY 5755, Pool, and Sassafras—that are housed in candles he can proudly display in his own bachelor pad.

Pioneer DJ DDJ-REV7 2-Channel Motorized DJ Controller

For the guy who loves to control the aux—this professional DJ deck is bound to delight. Don't be surprised if he spends the next few months on set lists to be performed at the next house party or rooftop gathering.

Bose QuietComfort 35 II Wireless Bluetooth Headphones

Audiophiles will never refuse an upgrade to their headphones. When it comes to tech gifts, there are lots of audio options out there, but these over-ear ones from Bose offer world-class noise cancellation, Bluetooth pairing they won’t have to fight to actually use, and a noise-rejecting microphone system. It’s a whole lot of power in a beautiful package. Go forth and skip the Apple Watch in favor of something a bit different.

Hatch Restore 2 Bedside Light, Sound Machine & Sunrise Alarm Clock

Getting up is hard and anyone who says otherwise is (probably) lying a little bit. The Hatch lamp helps make it a little easier, probably because it’s a full-fledged wake-up machine in one tiny package. Not only can the user set the traditional alarm, but there’s a time-activated light “alarm” that makes it feel like a little sliver of the sun has slipped right into the room. To round things out, the sound machine is great for lulling people to sleep.

Cozy Earth Serenity Silk Sleep Mask

It’s likely he wouldn’t think of all the benefits a silk sleep mask might have on his nighttime routine—but you will.

Loftie Alarm Clock

Waking up is slightly easier when you have an alarm clock that houses meditations, breath work circuits, Bluetooth speaker capabilities, and a gentle two-step system for jostling someone out of sleep. This is that alarm clock.

Postcard Cabins Stay

If he’s a nature buff, a weekend trip courtesy of Postcard Cabins is a gift the both of you can enjoy. With cabins located nationwide and stays starting at $109 per night (pending location, seasonality, and availability), a picturesque vacation is just a few clicks away.

Sonos Roam

Minimalist, compact, and rechargeable, this portable waterproof smart bluetooth speaker is chic enough to display at home, yet also small enough to bring along just about anywhere.

Apple AirPods Pro (2nd Generation)

If your dad is still listening to podcasts with wired headphones, Apple AirPods are a sure-fire gift choice that he can pair perfectly with his iPhone via Bluetooth. Not only are these earbuds wireless, but they also boast noise-cancellation technology for an immersive music experience.

Theragun Prime Plus

If he works out and travels a lot, this tiny muscle massager is one of the best gift ideas out there. The upgraded Theragun Prime Plus packs a ton of power into its three foam attachments. Plus its Bluetooth capability means you can connect it to the Theragun app for personalized use recommendations.

Bang & Olufsen Beolit 20 Speaker

If you'd rather take your audio cues from Alicia Keys and Swizz Beatz, gift him this portable speaker that's got Up to 37 hours of playtime, charges in 3 hours, and has a convenient handle for carrying to the BBQ or park hang.
